articles.author: Joe Hernandez
articles.title: A 105-year-old runner created a new age bracket for the 100m — and set the record - NPR
articles.description: Julia "Hurricane" Hawkins crossed the finish line in 1:02:95. "It was wonderful to see so many family members and friends. But I wanted to do it in less than a minute," she said.
articles.content:
A screenshot shows Julia "Hurricane" Hawkins after she set a new world record for the 100-meter in the women's 105+ age bracket.
National Senior Games
Don't bet against Julia "Hurricane" Hawkins.
